Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Serangoon Garden Secondary School" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(January 2021)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)*Government school **Serangoon Garden Secondary School** (SGS) is a co-educational government secondary school located in [Serangoon](/wiki/Serangoon), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). ## History Serangoon Garden Secondary School was founded in 1959 as Lichfield Secondary School at Lichfield Road in Serangoon. In 1969, the school absorbed the neighbouring school, Hwi Yoh Vocational School, and in 1970, became Serangoon Garden Secondary School. It became a bilingual secondary school with both English and Chinese streams, with facilities for the teaching of academic, technical and commercial subjects. In 1984, it became a purely English stream school with the last batch of Chinese stream graduating in the same year. The school moved to its current premises in 2004. ## Notable alumni - [Fandi Ahmad](/wiki/Fandi_Ahmad), national football player - [Laken Limbu](/wiki/Laken_Limbu), a Nepalese football player - [Sitoh Yih Pin](/wiki/Sitoh_Yih_Pin), Member of Parliament for Potong Pasir - [Chen Tianwen](/wiki/Chen_Tianwen), Singaporean [actor](/wiki/Actor) and [martial artist](/wiki/Martial_arts) - Official website This Singapore school-related article is a stub.
